actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on July 23, 2025.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Cohen moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

Ms. Randall asked unanimous consent that she may hereafter be considered as the first sponsor of H.R. 1522, a bill originally introduced by Representative Connolly, for the purpose of adding cosponsors and requesting reprintings pursuant to clause 7 of rule XII. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 360
actions-list.actionItem: 57 (Roll no. 216).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1917 — "To establish the Great Lakes Mass Marking Program, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 410
actions-list.actionItem: 1 (Roll no. 215).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 3937 — "To provide for the conveyance of certain Federal land in Chequamegon-Nicolet National Forest, and for other purposes."
The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on motions to suspend the rules, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1917.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Tiffany moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1917 — "To establish the Great Lakes Mass Marking Program, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3937.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Tiffany moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3937 — "To provide for the conveyance of certain Federal land in Chequamegon-Nicolet National Forest, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of July 22.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 600 — "Electing Members to certain standing committees of the House of Representatives."
The Chair designated Mr. Cisneros to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of July 22.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Randy Fine to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
